meanings.definition: To make a shrill, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The kettle began to chirre as it boiled on the stove.
meanings.sent2: The birds chirre happily in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The old door seemed to chirre in protest as it opened slowly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to chirre through the room, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the branches chirre softly, like a lullaby.

meanings.definition: A high-pitched sound, especially that made by a bird or insect
meanings.sent1: The chirre of the crickets filled the night air.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the chirre of the early birds outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The chirre of the alarm clock was the last thing he wanted to hear on a Sunday morning.
meanings.sent4: The chirre of the flute echoed through the valley, enchanting all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The chirre of the cicadas created a symphony of summer sounds.
